revised_title: Activity-Dependent Membrane Recycling in Mammalian Motor Nerve Terminals
tldr: The authors studied the activity-dependent membrane recycling in mammalian motor nerve terminals using the styryl dyes FM1-43 and FM2-10. They found that mammalian motor nerve terminals can be stained and destained with these dyes in an activity-dependent manner. The pattern of staining and destaining in mammalian terminals differs from that in frog neuromuscular junctions, and the timecourse of destaining reflects the rate of exocytosis and recycling of synaptic vesicles.
